title: Bento Box

verbs: To consume something solid or semi-solid (usually food) by putting it into the mouth and eventually swallowing it.
To consume (something solid or semi-solid, usually food) by putting it into the mouth and swallowing it.
nouns: Bento is a single-portion takeout or home-packed meal common in Japanese cuisine.
A (usually rectangular) container; may have a lid
A cuboid space; a container, usually with a hinged lid.
Box describes a variety of containers and receptacles for permanent use as storage, or for temporary use often for transporting contents.
Or any of a variety of containers or receptacles
Any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body. For prepared ready-to-eat food, use dish: Q746549.
Any substance consumed by living organisms to sustain life.
Any substance that can be consumed by living organisms, especially by eating, in order to sustain life.
Any solid substance (as opposed to liquid) that is used as a source of nourishment
Food is any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body.

description: A Japanese bento, a lunch box divided into portions of rice, vegetables, and meat or seafood, such as sushi or fried shrimp.
apple_vendor_description: The bento box emoji, as rendered on Apple devices, presents a meticulously organized and appetizing meal. Its container boasts soft, rounded edges and a subtle glossy sheen, reflecting the high-fidelity 3D shading characteristic of Apple‚Äôs design. Inside, distinct compartments reveal vibrant, perfectly rendered food items, showcasing Apple‚Äôs attention to detail and realistic lighting, making it ideal for expressing a delicious and thoughtful meal.
